pullRequest.title: Feature/achievements/checks
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.

no client changes included
Description
These changes add the functionality to check whether a student has earned an achievement.
This is done by using an EntityListener for the results. Every time a new result is saved or an existing result is updated, this ResultListener is invoked and calls the checkForAchievements() function from the AchievementService with the newly created/modified result as parameter. If the user has earned an achievement, it is assigned to him.
Steps for Testing
Since there is no client side yet which allows us to check whether we got an achievement or not the only testing needed is to make sure no existing functionality is broken. Especially when generating new results since then the ResultListener is triggered and executes the new code.
Aside from that code reviews would be helpful.
Test Coverage

ProgressBasedAchievementService.java: 89%
AchievementService.java 97%
TimeBasedAchievementService.java 97%
PointBasedAchievementService.java 97%
AchievementResource.java 100%
